docs.title: Slowlane 🐌
docs.text:
🐌

"Life in the fastlane is clear, but the slowlane is where the scenery is."

Production-grade Python CLI tool for Apple service automation. A chill, fastlane-compatible solution for authentication and App Store Connect/Developer Portal operations.

Tip

Why rush? Slowlane gets you there... eventually. (Actually it's quite fast, but we like to take our time with quality).

docs.title: Features
docs.text:
• 🔐 Multiple auth modes: JWT API keys, session cookies, interactive login
  • 📱 App Store Connect: Apps, builds, TestFlight management
  • 🔏 Developer Portal: Certificates and provisioning profiles
  • 📦 Upload: IPA upload via iTunes Transporter
  • 🔄 CI-friendly: Works on macOS, Linux, Windows with structured output

docs.title: Using API Key (Recommended for CI)
docs.text:
# Set environment variables
export ASC_KEY_ID="XXXXXXXXXX"
export ASC_ISSUER_ID="xxxxxxxx-xxxx-xxxx-xxxx-xxxxxxxxxxxx"
export ASC_PRIVATE_KEY="$(cat AuthKey_XXXXXXXXXX.p8)"

# List your apps
slowlane asc apps list

# Upload an IPA
slowlane upload ipa ./MyApp.ipa

docs.title: Using Session Auth
docs.text:
# Interactive login (opens browser)
slowlane spaceauth login

# Export session for CI
slowlane spaceauth export

# Use session in CI
export FASTLANE_SESSION="..."
slowlane asc apps list

docs.title: Authentication
docs.text: Slowlane supports two primary authentication methods for interacting with Apple's services: API Key (recommended for CI/CD) and Session Authentication (for interactive use or when API keys are insufficient).

docs.title: Method 1: App Store Connect API Key (Recommended)
docs.text: This is the most robust method for CI/CD pipelines. It uses a JSON Web Token (JWT) signed with your private key to authenticate requests.

docs.title: 1. Generate an API Key
docs.text:
1. Go to App Store Connect > Users and Access > Keys.
  2. Click + to generate a new key.
  3. Give it a name and select a role (e.g., "App Manager" or "Developer").
  4. Download the .p8 private key file. Store this securely.
  5. Note the Key ID and your Issuer ID.

docs.title: 2. Configure Environment Variables
docs.text:
Set the following environment variables in your local shell or CI configuration:

export ASC_KEY_ID="YOUR_KEY_ID"
export ASC_ISSUER_ID="YOUR_ISSUER_ID"
# Option A: Path to the .p8 file
export ASC_PRIVATE_KEY_PATH="/path/to/AuthKey_XXXXXXXXXX.p8"

# Option B: Content of the .p8 file (useful for some CI systems)
export ASC_PRIVATE_KEY="-----BEGIN PRIVATE KEY-----
...
-----END PRIVATE KEY-----"

docs.title: Method 2: Session Authentication
docs.text: Some operations (like managing certificates or provisioning profiles on the Developer Portal) may require a session-based login if the App Store Connect API doesn't fully support them, or if you prefer interactive login.

docs.title: Interactive Login
docs.text:
Run the login command to open a browser window and log in with your Apple ID. This supports 2FA.

slowlane spaceauth login --email user@example.com

This will save a session cookie to your machine.

docs.title: Exporting Session for CI/CD
docs.text:
To use session authentication in a headless CI environment:

  1. Log in interactively on your local machine.
  2. Export the session: 
    slowlane spaceauth export
    Output: 
    export FASTLANE_SESSION="ey... (long string) ..."
  3. Set the FASTLANE_SESSION environment variable in your CI system.

docs.title: Validating Session
docs.text:
Check if your session is still valid:

slowlane spaceauth doctor

docs.title: Security Best Practices
docs.text:
• Never commit your .p8 file or FASTLANE_SESSION to a public repository.
  • Use mechanism like GitHub Secrets or GitLab Variables to inject these values at runtime.
  • API Keys are long-lived but should be rotated periodically.
  • Sessions expire (usually after ~30 days) and must be refreshed manually.

docs.title: Global Options
docs.text:
• --verbose / --no-verbose: Enable verbose logging.
  • --format [text|json]: set output format.
  • --help: Show help message.

docs.title: slowlane spaceauth
docs.text:
Manage authentication sessions.

  • login: Interactive login to generate session.
  • --email: Apple ID email.
  • --service: Target service (appstoreconnect or developer).
  • export: Export session for CI use.
  • doctor: Check authentication status.
  • revoke: Revoke and clear local session.

docs.title: slowlane asc
docs.text: App Store Connect operations.

docs.title: apps
docs.text:
• list: List all apps.
  • get: Get details for a specific app.

docs.title: builds
docs.text:
• list: List builds for an app.
  • latest: Get the latest build number.

docs.title: testflight
docs.text:
• testers list: List beta testers.
  • invite: Invite a tester.
  • groups list: List beta groups.

docs.title: slowlane signing
docs.text: Developer Portal operations.

docs.title: certs
docs.text:
• list: List certificates.
  • create: Create a certificate.
  • revoke: Revoke a certificate.

docs.title: profiles
docs.text:
• list: List provisioning profiles.
  • create: Create a profile.
  • delete: Delete a profile.

docs.title: slowlane upload
docs.text: Upload operations.

docs.title: ipa
docs.text:
• path: Path to the IPA file.
  • --validate-only: Validate without uploading.
  • --platform: Target platform.

docs.title: Configuration
docs.text: Slowlane can be configured via a TOML file or environment variables.

docs.title: Config File
docs.text: The configuration file is located at ~/.config/slowlane/config.toml (Linux/macOS) or %APPDATA%\slowlane\config.toml (Windows).

docs.title: Example Configuration
docs.text:
[auth]
# Default authentication mode: "jwt" or "session"
default_mode = "jwt"

[http]
# Request timeout in seconds
timeout = 30
# Number of retries for failed requests
max_retries = 3

[output]
# Output format: "text" (default) or "json"
format = "text"
# Show verbose logs
verbose = false

docs.title: Environment Variables
docs.text:
Environment variables override config file settings.

Variable Description ASC_KEY_ID App Store Connect Key ID ASC_ISSUER_ID App Store Connect Issuer ID ASC_PRIVATE_KEY Private Key content (PEM format) ASC_PRIVATE_KEY_PATH Path to Private Key file (.p8) FASTLANE_SESSION Base64 encoded session cookie SLOWLANE_FORMAT Output format (text, json) SLOWLANE_VERBOSE Set to true for debug logs

docs.title: Installation
docs.text: Slowlane is a Python package and can be installed via pip or poetry.

docs.title: Prerequisites
docs.text:
• Python 3.11 or higher
  • (Optional) Xcode or Transporter app for IPA uploads on macOS

docs.title: pip (Recommended)
docs.text: pip install slowlane

docs.title: poetry
docs.text: poetry add slowlane

docs.title: Install Playwright (Optional)
docs.text:
If you plan to use interactive login (slowlane spaceauth login), you need to install Playwright browsers:

pip install playwright
playwright install chromium

This is only required for the interactive login flow. CI environments using API keys or pre-generated sessions do not need Playwright.

docs.title: Verification
docs.text:
Verify the installation by checking the version:

slowlane --version

docs.title: Managing Apps
docs.text: Interact with your apps on App Store Connect.

docs.title: List Apps
docs.text:
List all apps associated with your credentials:

slowlane asc apps list

Options: - --limit <number>: Limit the number of results. - --platform <platform>: Filter by platform (e.g., IOS).

docs.title: Get App Details
docs.text:
Get details for a specific app by its Bundle ID or Apple ID:

slowlane asc apps get com.example.my-app
# OR
slowlane asc apps get 1234567890

docs.title: Create App
docs.text: Currently, creating apps is done via the web interface to ensure all metadata is correctly properly set up initially.

docs.title: Builds & TestFlight
docs.text: Manage your builds and TestFlight beta testing.

docs.title: List Builds
docs.text:
List all builds for a specific app:

slowlane asc builds list com.example.my-app

docs.title: Get Latest Build
docs.text:
Find the latest build number for a specific version or the latest overall:

slowlane asc builds latest com.example.my-app

docs.title: Testers
docs.text:
List all beta testers:

slowlane asc testflight testers list

Invite a tester to a group:

slowlane asc testflight invite \
  --email new.tester@example.com \
  --first-name John \
  --last-name Doe \
  --group "External Testers"

docs.title: Groups
docs.text:
List TestFlight groups:

slowlane asc testflight groups list

docs.title: Certificates
docs.text: Manage your signing certificates for distribution and development.

docs.title: List Certificates
docs.text:
List all valid certificates:

slowlane signing certs list

docs.title: Creates a Certificate
docs.text:
Create a new distribution certificate (e.g., for the App Store):

slowlane signing certs create --type distribution

Create a development certificate:

slowlane signing certs create --type development

docs.title: Revoke a Certificate
docs.text:
Revoke a certificate by its Serial Number or ID:

slowlane signing certs revoke --id CERT_ID

Warning: Revoking a distribution certificate will invalidate any provisioning profiles that use it. Ensure you really want to do this.

docs.title: Provisioning Profiles
docs.text: Manage provisioning profiles (mobileprovision files) which link your app ID, certificates, and devices.

docs.title: List Profiles
docs.text:
slowlane signing profiles list

Filtered by type: 

slowlane signing profiles list --type appstore

docs.title: Create a Profile
docs.text:
Create a new profile for App Store distribution:

slowlane signing profiles create \
  --name "Match AppStore com.example.app" \
  --bundle-id com.example.app \
  --type appstore \
  --certificate-id CERT_ID

For Ad Hoc distribution (requires registered devices):

slowlane signing profiles create \
  --name "Match AdHoc com.example.app" \
  --bundle-id com.example.app \
  --type adhoc \
  --certificate-id CERT_ID \
  --devices "device_id1,device_id2"

docs.title: Delete a Profile
docs.text: slowlane signing profiles delete --id PROFILE_ID

docs.title: Uploading to App Store
docs.text:
Upload your binary (.ipa or .pkg) to App Store Connect.

Slowlane uses the iTMSTransporter tool (on macOS) or the native API where possible to robustly upload builds.

docs.title: Upload IPA
docs.text: slowlane upload ipa ./path/to/MyApp.ipa

docs.title: Options
docs.text:
• --validate-only: detailed validation without uploading.
  • --platform: specific platform (default: ios).

docs.title: Prerequisites
docs.text:
• On macOS: Requires Xcode or the Transporter app installed.
  • On Linux/Windows: Upload capabilities are limited by Apple's tooling availability. Most users perform uploads from a macOS runner in CI.

docs.title: Troubleshooting Uploads
docs.text: If you encounter iTMSTransporter errors, ensure: 1. You have accepted the latest agreements in App Store Connect. 2. Your firewall allows connections to Apple's transporter servers. 3. The IPA is correctly signed for App Store Distribution (not Development or Ad Hoc).
